subject: Home & DIY
title: Smart Bulbs vs Smart Switches
description: A micro-lesson that makes Smart Bulbs vs Smart Switches usable.

hook.text: Smart bulbs and smart switches both automate lighting. Picking the wrong one leads to frustration and regret.

buildup.text: Smart bulbs offer color and per-bulb dimming but die if someone flips the wall switch offâ€”a common annoyance.

discovery.text: Smart switches replace the wall toggle. They control every bulb in the fixture and work for guests who flip switches.

twist.text: A 6-bulb chandelier with smart bulbs costs 6x more with 6 failure points. One smart switch controls them all.

climax.text: Best practice: smart switches for overheads, smart bulbs only where you need color controlâ€”accent lamps and strips.

punchline.text: Switch where you can, bulb where you must.

quiz.question: What is the main drawback of using smart bulbs for overhead lighting?
options: They stop working if someone flips the wall switch off
They consume more energy than standard LED bulbs
They can only be controlled by one person at a time
